alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 11:58PM MDT until June 15 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Kinnear affecting Fremont County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Crowheart affecting Fremont County. Wind River at Riverton affecting Fremont County. .Warm temperatures this past weekend melted high mountain snowpack and increased river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wind River near Crowheart. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Very minor low land flooding begins. At 10.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor low land flooding becomes more widespread. Access road to gage begins to be covered with water. At 10.5 feet, Moderate low land flooding upstream and downstream of gage. Access to gage is becomes limited. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM MDT Monday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate near flood stage with a maximum value of 10.2 feet Tuesday afternoon. It will fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
